Thus, the logic in Fortran can be written as a loop:

do I = 1, k

    if (str(i:i ) /= '1') then 

        print *, str(i:i)

        stop

    end if

So in Fortran, instead, after looping up to I =k (because it's 1-based), then if we made it through all, then print 1.
